org.platanios.learn.optimization

Class CoordinateDescentSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.platanios.learn.optimization.AbstractIterativeSolver
      • org.platanios.learn.optimization.AbstractLineSearchSolver
        • org.platanios.learn.optimization.CoordinateDescentSolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Solver

    public final class CoordinateDescentSolver
extends AbstractLineSearchSolver
    This is a derivative-free optimization algorithm. TODO: Implement a pattern-search solver. TODO: Implement the DFO conjugate direction solver. TODO: Implement the Nelder-Mead solver. TODO: Implement the implicit filtering solver.
    Author:
    Emmanouil Antonios Platanios

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private CoordinateDescentSolver(CoordinateDescentSolver.AbstractBuilder<?> builder)
      Default method is the CYCLE_AND_JOIN_ENDPOINTS method because empirically it seems to perform better than the others.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void updateDirection()
      Note: Care must be taken when implementing this method because the previousDirection and the previousPoint variables are simply updated to point to currentDirection and currentPoint respectively, at the beginning of each iteration.
      void updatePoint()
      Note: Care must be taken when implementing this method because the previousDirection and the previousPoint variables are simply updated to point to currentDirection and currentPoint respectively, at the beginning of each iteration.

    • Method Detail

      • updateDirection

        public void updateDirection()
        Description copied from class: AbstractLineSearchSolver
        Note: Care must be taken when implementing this method because the previousDirection and the previousPoint variables are simply updated to point to currentDirection and currentPoint respectively, at the beginning of each iteration. That means that when the new values are computed, new objects have to be instantiated for holding those values.
        Specified by:
        updateDirection in class AbstractLineSearchSolver

      • updatePoint

        public void updatePoint()
        Description copied from class: AbstractLineSearchSolver
        Note: Care must be taken when implementing this method because the previousDirection and the previousPoint variables are simply updated to point to currentDirection and currentPoint respectively, at the beginning of each iteration. That means that when the new values are computed, new objects have to be instantiated for holding those values.
        Specified by:
        updatePoint in class AbstractLineSearchSolver
